name: Burmese Brown Tortoise
description: The Burmese Brown Tortoise is a large reptile with a dark shell, known for its herbivorous diet.
spread_note: Found in Southeast Asia, including Thailand and Myanmar.
reproduction: Lays 20-50 eggs in a ground nest, incubation about 60-90 days.
attractions: Notable in zoos for their longevity and calm demeanor.
projects_note: Vulnerable due to habitat loss and pet trade; conservation is active.
